extendedIngredients.name: carrots
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound carrots, peeled, julienned or coarsely grated

extendedIngredients.name: fresh cilantro leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup fresh cilantro leaves with tender stems

extendedIngredients.name: red pepper flakes
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes

extendedIngredients.name: unsalted pistachios
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup unsalted, shelled raw pistachios

recipes.title: Carrot Salad with Coriander Vinaigrette and Pistachios

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Salad. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. The Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 35 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Aromas of apricot, guava and pineapple juice mingle with hints of sweet vanilla and warm toasty notes.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 350. Toast pistachios on a rimmed baking sheet, tossing occasionally, until golden brown, 68 minutes. Let cool; coarsely chop.Toast coriander in a small dry skillet over medium heat, tossing often, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Let cool; coarsely chop.Whisk garlic, lemon juice, red pepper flakes, and coriander in a large bowl, then whisk in oil; season with salt. Add carrots, toss, and let sit at least 30 minutes. Toss with cilantro and pistachios just before serving.DO AHEAD: Salad (without cilantro and nuts) can be made 1 day ahead. Cover; chill.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 350. Toast pistachios on a rimmed baking sheet, tossing occasionally, until golden brown, 68 minutes.
Let cool; coarsely chop.Toast coriander in a small dry skillet over medium heat, tossing often, until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Whisk garlic, lemon juice, red pepper flakes, and coriander in a large bowl, then whisk in oil; season with salt.
Add carrots, toss, and let sit at least 30 minutes. Toss with cilantro and pistachios just before serving.DO AHEAD: Salad (without cilantro and nuts) can be made 1 day ahead. Cover; chill.
